Name: Funerary cone
Description: An intact funerary cone, inscribed at one end with the owners name. The signs are both irregular and undivided, this may indicate an early date.The cones were placed at the entrance to the tomb, probably pushed into the wet plaster of the lintel. They are first recorded in the 12th Dynasty but the majority date to the 18th Dynasty and come from Thebes. The broad end of the cone was usually stamped with the deceased's names and titles, this information would have been visible to all who passed by the tomb.
